title: Enthalpy of reaction from bond energy, enthalpy of reaction from standard enthalpy of formation, enthalpy of reaction from Hess’s Law
body: The measured enthalpy change for burning ketene (CH₂CO) is ΔHa $$=$$ $$-981.1$$ kJ at 25°C: CH₂CO(g) + $$2$$ O₂(g) → $$2$$ CO₂(g) + H₂O(g). The enthalpy change for burning methane is ΔHb $$=$$ $$-802.3$$ kJ at 25°C: CH₄(g) + $$2$$ O₂(g) → CO₂(g) + $$2$$ H₂O(g)
